definition: to join up with sb/to become partner/to take meals regularly in cafeteria
to put up/to build (scaffolding)/to hang (clothes on a pole)/to connect/to join/to arrange in pairs/to match/to add/to throw in (resources)/to take (boat, train)/variant of 褡[da1]
meals (abbr. for 伙食[huo3 shi2])/variant of 夥|伙[huo3]
to live one's life/to pass one's days/to get along
to bring together/to make do in a bad situation/to just get by/to improvise/passable/not too bad
to go with sb/to form companionships
to accept (a bit reluctantly)/to put up with
to ride (in a vehicle)/to get a lift/to hitch-hike
to get along well/compatible/also written 和得來|和得来[he2 de5 lai2]
to ask for help/to ask a favor/to recruit talented people
lit. to be together from the first beat (idiom)/to hit it off/to click together/to chime in easily
to eat out/to eat at a restaurant
to disband/(of a partnership, group etc) to break up
to rent jointly with other people/co-renting
